meanings.definition: To commit burglary by breaking into a building with the intent to steal.
meanings.sent1: The thief tried to burgle the house late at night.
meanings.sent2: Criminals often burgle homes when the owners are away.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clumsy burglar try to burgle a police station?
meanings.sent4: The idea to burgle the bank vault seemed like a daring heist.
meanings.sent5: The cat burglar's plan to burgle the mansion was foiled by a vigilant security guard.

meanings.sent1: The burgle of the jewelry store shocked the small town.
meanings.sent2: Police were investigating the recent burgle at the convenience store.
meanings.sent3: The burgle of the bakery turned out to be a prank by mischievous kids.
meanings.sent4: The burgle of the art gallery left the community feeling unsafe.
meanings.sent5: The news of the burgle spread quickly through the neighborhood.
